scripts.comment: Works for column vectors and matrices (column major order) : returns a vector of all elements in column major order

block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [,,,] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].
Reports a new list containing the items of the input list, but in the opposite order.

scripts.comment: Matrix indexing a la MATLAB Accepts various combinations of scalars, lists and : The : means "all" List inputs can contain valid indexes in any order and even the same index multiple times.
returns 0 for scalars, and a 2-element list for vectors and matrices
no argument check... assumes true vectors...
